com.wm.app.b2b.server

Class ServerStartupNotifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wm.app.b2b.server.ServerStartupNotifier

  • public class ServerStartupNotifier
extends java.lang.Object
    The ServerStartupNotifier class is used to perform initialization tasks that require that Integration Server completes its startup sequence. A portion of the Integration Server startup occurs after all the package startup services run, notably enabling listeners and starting the trigger dispatcher. If you have a startup service that requires these features, you can use the waitForStartup or registerForStartup methods to ensure that your code executes after they are available.

    • Method Detail

      • waitForStartup

        public void waitForStartup()
        Blocks the calling thread until Integration Server completes its startup sequence. This can be used when your package needs to perform initialization tasks that require that the server finishes its startup sequence. If the server completes its startup before this method is called, it returns immediately.

        This method should not be called directly from a startup service as the service will block and keep the server from completing its startup sequence. Your startup service should create a separate thread and call it from there. For example: 

         public static void myStartup(IData pipeline) {
     Thread thread = new Thread() {
         public void run() {
             ServerStartupNotifier notifier = ServerStartupNotifier();
             notifier.waitForStartup();
             //
             // Perform initialization tasks here.
             //
         }
     }
     thread.start();
 }

      • registerForStartup

        public void registerForStartup(java.lang.String service,
                               IData pipeline)
        Registers a service to be called when the Integration Server completes its startup sequence. This can be used when your package needs to perform initialization tasks that require that the server first finishes its startup sequence.

        Unlike waitForStartup, registerForStartup does not block. Once the server has started, registered services are invoked. Note that order of execution is not guaranteed. The services are passed into the server's main thread pool and may be executed out of order.

        If the server's startup sequence is complete when this method is called, no registration occurs and the services are not invoked.

        Parameters:
        service - Fully qualified name of the service to invoke when the server's startup sequence is complete. If the service throws an Exception, it will appear in the error log.
        pipeline - Pipeline to pass to service. May be null.
